alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 1:39PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Alleghany and northeastern Ashe Counties in northwestern North Carolina, southeastern Smyth and central Grayson Counties in southwestern Virginia through 215 PM EDT... At 138 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Rogers Summit, or near Sugar Grove, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mouth Of Wilson... Sugar Grove... Troutdale... Volney... Rugby... Stratford... and Flatridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for northwestern North Carolina...and southwestern Virginia. Additional statements will be issued as conditions warrant.
